info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 3:50PM EDT until September 07 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Henderson County in western North Carolina... Southwestern Polk County in western North Carolina... North central Greenville County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 349 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Jones Gap State Park, or 12 miles south of Hendersonville, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Flat Rock, Jones Gap State Park, Dupont State Forest, Tuxedo, North Saluda Reservoir, Glassy Mountain, East Flat Rock, and Crab Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
